Maintainer: ALT Linux Team, ALT Linux LLC

Cost: Some editions are free of charge

Founder: CANTV / CNTI / CENTIDEL / Edelca / VIT / FUNDACITE / Free software community
Maintainer: CANTV / CNTI / CENTIDEL / Edelca / VIT / FUNDACITE / Free software community

Founder: Jan Mette and Arch Linux KDEmod developers
Default package management tool(s): Pacman (will be replaced by Akabei in future)

Cost: Some editions are free of charge

System distribution commitment: Debian Social Contract and DFSG (main is 100% free, non-free packages are optional)[16]
Default Linux kernel: By default Linux-libre, but the Debian Project also hosts a non-free repository allowing blobs to be installed optionally.[82] Built with Linux-libre tools.[86]

Install-time desktop environment or wind: GNOME (default Workstation Edition), Spins for: KDE Plasma Workspaces, Xfce, LXDE, MATE (with Compiz), Cinnamon, Sugar on a Stick

Maintainer: Ludovic Courtès, Ricardo Wurmus, the Guix community
Install-time desktop environment or wind: GNOME, Xfce, Mate, Enlightenment, i3, ratpoison, xmonad

Maintainer: Sam Geeraerts with sponsorship from the FSF
Default Linux kernel: Debian Linux kernel, and (unlike Debian) blobs cannot be installed[86]

Target audience: live, maintenance, security, network, forensic, accessibility

System distribution commitment: 100% Free: GNU FSDG[5] followed in Hyperbola Social Contract

Founder: Max Moser, Mati Aharoni, Martin J. Muench

Cost: Some editions are free of charge

Default package management tool(s): XBMCbuntu addon manager, own and 3rd party addons

System distribution commitment: 100% Free: GNU FSDG[5] followed in Parabola Social Contract
Default installer: None (third-party install scripts only) or Calamares

Founder: Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey (TÜBİTAK)

Install-time desktop environment or wind: KDE Plasma Workspaces, GNOME, LXDE, Xfce, Enlightenment, Openbox

Founder: Michael Zanetta, Rick Farina, Jens Pranaitis

Default file system: Squashfs, ext2, ext3, ext4, FAT32, reiser, xfs

Founder: Cyrille Pontvieux, George Vlahavas, Pierrick Le Brun, Thorsten Mühlfelder

Forked from: Red Hat Linux, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)

Default file system: ext4, ext3, ext2, reiserfs, brtfs, xfs
Install-time desktop environment or wind: KDE, XFCE Fluxbox, Blackbox, fvwm2 twm

System distribution commitment: Common code base for x86-64, Power, System z, Arm64

Target audience: security-focused aimed for anonymity and privacy

Forked from: Independent, inspired from Damn Small Linux

Security updates (years): Debian packages as per Debian; TurnKey packages for life of current major version (plus backports per request)
Target audience: server based software appliance library aiming to balance security and ease of use
Install-time desktop environment or wind: none - headless server by design; provides Webmin for administration
arm: No - but under development by community
Approximate number of source packages: 21,041[r] (currently TurnKey only supplies source code for custom packages)

Security updates (years): Standard releases 1 year, LTS releases 5 years. Flavor LTS releases 3 or 5 years. Ubuntu Pro 10 years.
Target audience: general, server, desktop, supercomputer, IBM mainframe

Security updates (years): up to 6 months for the free Core Edition; if maintenance is purchased, it's up to 7 years, see:[76]
Cost: Core Edition is free of charge

Forked from: Ututo XS: Gentoo Linux, Ututo UL: Ubuntu
Default Linux kernel: Ututo XS (stable) is de-blobbed with Linux-libre tools.[111] Ututo UL (development) uses Linux-libre. Ututo UL means "Ubuntu-Libre"

Cost: Some editions are free of charge
Zorin OS Lite & Core are free, while Business and Ultimate are paid for
